About

A student, runner and Enthusiast for statistics.

I am Shan Jiang(姜珊), a master student at the Department of biostatistics, from Columbia University, my research interests fall into computational social science and network analysis, health sociology. Prior to my graduate school studies, I received my B.A. at Central University of Finance and Economics, China.

This website contains several main sections including my projects, my comments on classical sociological papers, statistical resources, and some tutorials for data visualization in R.

Education

  • B.A. Sociology(Minor Economics), Central University of Finance and Economics, China, 2014 – 2018
  • Exchange, Johns Hopkins University, US, 2016
  • M.S. Biostatistics(Theory and Methods), Columbia University, US, 2018 – Now

Statistics resources

Top R packages

  • Rcpp, provides a combination of R and C++.
  • stringr, extremely useful for text mining.
  • ggplot, a well-known pakage for data visualization.
  • Table 1, extremely usefu for organizing tables for publish on journals.

Computational Sociology resource

  • Five Thirty Eight for political data visualization;
  • Introduction to Educational and Psychological Measurement Using R for factor analysis and scaling, scoring.
